column4: bluetooth isn't working on my laptop (hp 6830s) any way to fix this?
have you tried searching for proprietary drivers?
go to: System -> Administration -> Hardware Drivers | It will scan your box for hardware that would require proprietary, non-open source drivers.
the only hardware detected is my ati card
do you have any hotkey on your keyboard to vary off/on the bluetooth antennae?
yeah but it's turned on
does the bluetooth logo appear at the top right with other processes?
the appelet is there but "send files to device" and "browse files on device" are both grayed out

it could be the device you're interfacing with blocking it and not Ubuntu. With my previous phone, I could browse the entire drive, with my new phone, I have to setup a specific folder to accept bluetooth sent items before it even allows it.
have you tried whatever bluetooth device you're trying to interface with on anoter operating system before, as a frame of reference?
had no problem previously on vista/xp
have you ran an update on Ubuntu?
I'm on 9.04
what's the device you're trying to sync to?
a nokia 6210 navigator
try not setting the bluetooth "handshake" to require a PIN
there is no pin set on my phone

set your phone on discovery mode, then when you have the bluetooth program search for devices, un-check the box the makes it ask for a PIN or for you to make one up; there should be an option for a PIN-less handshake
I found the problem, it's the integrated blutooth device of my laptop, plugged a usb/bluetooth adaptor and it's working fine
thank you for your time ;)
no problem, did that work for you?
yes it's working fine now
ok good! That was my first fix/help on here!
